lead_paragraph: The California Coastal Commission today soundly rejected a proposal to allow the new Japanese owner of the Pebble Beach golf course to sell high-priced memberships. The commission's 10-1 vote represents a stunning blow to Minoru Isutani, the Japanese golf course tycoon who was counting on selling the memberships to pay back much of the $574 million he borrowed to purchase the Pebble Beach Company last year. The company had hoped to sell as many as 2,000 memberships for about $150,000 apiece, raising $300 million.

headline.main: Pebble Beach Rebuffed On Membership Plan
